record.description: Tablets of Sumerian literary and lexical texts, several hundred complete or fragmentary, were discovered in 1952 by a joint expedition of the University of Chicago and the University of Pennsylvania at the city of Nippur in Iraq. The tablets were scattered along one wall of a room presumed to be the quarters of scribes.
record.publisher: University of Chicago Library, Special Collections Research Center
record.noteGeneral: Separate caption. PR stamps. Most of copies were originally # 42, but were duplicates of # 14.
